text: This letter is from Paul, a missionary of Jesus Christ. God has sent me to tell that He has promised life that lasts forever through Christ Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am writing to you, Timothy. You are my much-loved son. May God the Father and Christ Jesus our Lord give you His loving-favor and loving-kindness and peace.
speaker: Narrator

text: I thank God for you. I pray for you night and day. I am working for God the way my early fathers worked. My heart says I am free from sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: When I remember your tears, it makes me want to see you. That would fill me with joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: I remember your true faith. It is the same faith your grandmother Lois had and your mother Eunice had. I am sure you have that same faith also.
speaker: Narrator

text: For this reason, I ask you to keep using the gift God gave you. It came to you when I laid my hands on you and prayed that God would use you.
speaker: Narrator

text: For God did not give us a spirit of fear. He gave us a spirit of power and of love and of a good mind.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not be ashamed to tell others about what our Lord said, or of me here in prison. I am here because of Jesus Christ. Be ready to suffer for preaching the Good News and God will give you the strength you need.
speaker: Narrator

text: He is the One Who saved us from the punishment of sin. He is the One Who chose us to do His work. It is not because of anything we have done. But it was His plan from the beginning that He would give us His loving-favor through Christ Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: We know about it now because of the coming of Jesus Christ, the One Who saves. He put a stop to the power of death and brought life that never dies which is seen through the Good News.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have been chosen to be a missionary and a preacher and a teacher of this Good News.
speaker: Narrator

text: For this reason, I am suffering. But I am not ashamed. I know the One in Whom I have put my trust. I am sure He is able to keep safe that which I have trusted to Him until the day He comes again.
speaker: Narrator

text: Keep all the things I taught you. They were given to you in the faith and love of Jesus Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: Keep safe that which He has trusted you with by the Holy Spirit Who lives in us.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am sure you have heard that all the Christians in the countries of Asia have turned away from me. Phygelus and Hermogenes turned away also.
speaker: Narrator

text: Onesiphorus was not ashamed of me in prison. He came often to comfort me. May the Lord show loving-kindness to his family.
speaker: Narrator

text: When he came to Rome, he looked everywhere until he found me.
speaker: Narrator

text: You know what a help he was to me in Ephesus. When the Lord comes again, may He show loving-kindness to Onesiphorus.
speaker: Narrator

text: So you, my son, be strong in the loving-favor of Christ Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: What you have heard me say in front of many people, you must teach to faithful men. Then they will be able to teach others also.
speaker: Narrator

text: Take your share of suffering as a good soldier of Jesus Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: No soldier fighting in a war can take time to make a living. He must please the one who made him a soldier.
speaker: Narrator

text: Anyone who runs in a race must follow the rules to get the crown.
speaker: Narrator

text: A hard-working farmer should receive first some of what he gathers from the field.
speaker: Narrator

text: Think about these things and the Lord will help you understand them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember this! Jesus Christ, Who was born from the early family of David, was raised from the dead! This is the Good News I preach.
speaker: Narrator

text: I suffer much and am in prison as one who has done something very bad. I am in chains, but the Word of God is not chained.
speaker: Narrator

text: I suffer all things so the people that God has chosen can be saved from the punishment of their sin through Jesus Christ. Then they will have God’s shining-greatness that lasts forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: These things are true. If we die with Him, we will live with Him also.
speaker: Narrator

text: If we suffer and stay true to Him, then we will be a leader with Him. If we say we do not know Him, He will say He does not know us.
speaker: Narrator

text: If we have no faith, He will still be faithful for He cannot go against what He is.
speaker: Narrator

text: Tell your people about these things again. In the name of the Lord, tell them not to argue over words that are not important. It helps no one and it hurts the faith of those who are listening.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do your best to know that God is pleased with you. Be as a workman who has nothing to be ashamed of. Teach the words of truth in the right way.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not listen to foolish talk about things that mean nothing. It only leads people farther away from God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Such talk will spread like cancer. Hymenaeus and Philetus are like this.
speaker: Narrator

text: They have turned from the truth. They say the dead have already been raised. The faith of some people has been made weak because of such foolish talk.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the truth of God cannot be changed. It says, “The Lord knows those who are His.” And, “Everyone who says he is a Christian must turn away from sin!”
speaker: Narrator

text: In a big house there are not only things made of gold and silver, but also of wood and clay. Some are of more use than others. Some are used every day.
speaker: Narrator

text: If a man lives a clean life, he will be like a dish made of gold. He will be respected and set apart for good use by the owner of the house.
speaker: Narrator

text: Turn away from the sinful things young people want to do. Go after what is right. Have a desire for faith and love and peace. Do this with those who pray to God from a clean heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let me say it again. Have nothing to do with foolish talk and those who want to argue. It can only lead to trouble.
speaker: Narrator

text: A servant owned by God must not make trouble. He must be kind to everyone. He must be able to teach. He must be willing to suffer when hurt for doing good.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be gentle when you try to teach those who are against what you say. God may change their hearts so they will turn to the truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they will know they had been held in a trap by the devil to do what he wanted them to do. But now they are able to get out of it.
speaker: Narrator

text: You must understand that in the last days there will come times of much trouble.
speaker: Narrator

text: People will love themselves and money. They will have pride and tell of all the things they have done. They will speak against God. Children and young people will not obey their parents. People will not be thankful and they will not be holy.
speaker: Narrator

text: They will not love each other. No one can get along with them. They will tell lies about others. They will not be able to keep from doing things they know they should not do. They will be wild and want to beat and hurt those who are good.
speaker: Narrator

text: They will not stay true to their friends. They will act without thinking. They will think too much of themselves. They will love fun instead of loving God.
speaker: Narrator

text: They will do things to make it look as if they are Christians. But they will not receive the power that is for a Christian. Keep away from such people.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the kind of people who go from house to house. They talk to foolish women who are loaded down with sins and all kinds of sinful desires.
speaker: Narrator

text: Such women are always listening to new teaching. But they are never able to understand the truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jannes and Jambres fought against Moses. So do these teachers fight against the truth today. Their minds think only of sinful things. They have turned against the Christian teaching.
speaker: Narrator

text: They will not get very far. Their foolish teaching will be seen by everyone. That was the way it was with the two who worked against Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: But you know what I teach and how I live. You know what I want to do. You know about my faith and my love. You know how long I am willing to wait for something. You know how I keep on working for God even when it is hard for me.
speaker: Narrator

text: You know about all the troubles and hard times I have had. You have seen how I suffered in the cities of Antioch and Iconium and Lystra. Yet the Lord brought me out of all those troubles.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yes! All who want to live a God-like life who belong to Christ Jesus will suffer from others.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sinful men and false teachers will go from bad to worse. They will lead others the wrong way and will be led the wrong way themselves.
speaker: Narrator

text: But as for you, hold on to what you have learned and know to be true. Remember where you learned them.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have known the Holy Writings since you were a child. They are able to give you wisdom that leads to being saved from the punishment of sin by putting your trust in Christ Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the Holy Writings are God-given and are made alive by Him. Man is helped when he is taught God’s Word. It shows what is wrong. It changes the way of a man’s life. It shows him how to be right with God.
speaker: Narrator

text: It gives the man who belongs to God everything he needs to work well for Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: These words are from my heart to you. I say this before God and Jesus Christ. Some day He will judge those who are living and those who are dead. It will be when Christ comes to bring His holy nation.
speaker: Narrator

text: Preach the Word of God. Preach it when it is easy and people want to listen and when it is hard and people do not want to listen. Preach it all the time. Use the Word of God to show people they are wrong. Use the Word of God to help them do right. You must be willing to wait for people to understand what you teach as you teach them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The time will come when people will not listen to the truth. They will look for teachers who will tell them only what they want to hear.
speaker: Narrator

text: They will not listen to the truth. Instead, they will listen to stories made up by men.
speaker: Narrator

text: You must watch for all these things. Do not be afraid to suffer for our Lord. Preach the Good News from place to place. Do all the work you are to do.
speaker: Narrator

text: It will soon be time for me to leave this life.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have fought a good fight. I have finished the work I was to do. I have kept the faith.
speaker: Narrator

text: There is a crown which comes from being right with God. The Lord, the One Who will judge, will give it to me on that great day when He comes again. I will not be the only one to receive a crown. All those who love to think of His coming and are looking for Him will receive one also.
speaker: Narrator

text: Come to me here as soon as you can.
speaker: Narrator

text: Demas left me. He loved the things of this world and has gone to the city of Thessalonica. Crescens has gone to the city of Galatia. Titus has gone to the city of Dalmatia.
speaker: Narrator

text: Luke is the only one with me here. Bring Mark when you come. He is a help to me in this work.
speaker: Narrator

text: I sent Tychicus to the city of Ephesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: When you come, bring the coat I left with Carpus in the city of Troas. Bring the books and for sure do not forget the writings written on sheepskin.
speaker: Narrator

text: Alexander, the man who makes things out of copper, has worked hard against me. The Lord will give him the pay that is coming to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Watch him! He fought against every word we preached.
speaker: Narrator

text: At my first trial no one helped me. Everyone left me. I hope this will not be held against them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Lord was with me. He gave me power to preach the Good News so all the people who do not know God might hear. I was taken from the mouth of the lion.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord will look after me and will keep me from every sinful plan they have. He will bring me safe into His holy nation of heaven. May He have all the shining-greatness forever. Let it be so.
speaker: Narrator

text: Greet Priscilla and Aquila for me and to all the family of Onesiphorus.
speaker: Narrator

text: Erastus stayed in the city of Corinth. I left Trophimus sick in the city of Miletus.
speaker: Narrator

text: Try to come before winter. Eubulus, Pudens, Linus, Claudia, and all the Christian brothers greet you.
speaker: Narrator

text: May the Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit. May you have God’s loving-favor.
speaker: Narrator
